intro: Licaria sericea, commonly known as silky licaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and showy, pink or white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Licaria sericea is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some areas.
